reviewText: I'm a great fan of Frankie Valli's music but this concert was really poor, particularly Valli himself. The rest of the group were in far better voice (and tune) and the general sound of the DVD is not great. He's still a favourite, but this DVD isn't.

reviewText: Being a HUGE 4 Seasons fan, I thought this would be a great dvd to have - all the guys, live!! WRONG !  Apparently, Frankie Valli now owns the name "The 4 Seasons" and that is what his back up singers are referred to!!  They are just a bunch of guys! I'm not saying they're aren't accomplished musicians & singers, etc..etc but they are not the guys who sang & performed all those wonderful hits so many years ago.  I was hoping that I could "go back"...but you cannot.  Whadda ya gonna do.
summary: Wow... This is NOT what I expected.....

reviewText: I really enjoyed this dvd. The concert, filmed in the early 1990's took place in a relatively small venue, and had a casual intimate atmosphere. Frankie Valli sounded great. Though he was a little reserved at times, his performance, for the most part, was very strong and reminiscent of the early rock 'n' roll/doo wop sound. His interpretations of ballads like "Silence is Golden", and "My Eyes Adored You" come across as more tender and sensitive than the studio versions. In addition to hits like "Grease", "Dawn", and "Can't Take My Eyes Off You" there are also some little known treasures included like, "Silver Star", and "Fallen Angel". Although the Four Seasons are replacements for the originals, they do an exceptionally good job, especially the very talented and charismatic singer and keyboardist, Tim Stone. If you're a fan of Frankie Valli this would be an excellent addition to your collection.Jennifer K. LaffertyAuthor of Offbeat Love Stories and More

reviewText: Having seen Jersey Boys twice now and growing up with FVFS on the air, it was good to see him here.Though this was 30 years after he started, it seemed as if he warmed up slowly and by the end of the show, was amazing again. It was a casino club stage venue in Atlantic City. Their catalog of music is extensive for those of us who loved them well, and many who do not know of them well do not know this. They were to the East Coast what the Beach Boys were to the West Coast at the same time and fought hard to stay on the air amidst the newly hyped Beatlemania craze at the same time and British Invasion which I think negatively impacted the whole US music scene. So many excellent groups and US-made songwriting was going on yet it seemed the media was bent on supporting this "British Invasion" then and to this damn day, and so much quality American made music was going on at the same time being overshadowed until now, when people are able to buy these cd's and start to remember the US they grew up in then and how good we really had it back then... NO comparison to what this nation has become today.My first concert I ever bought tickets to as a teenager were for Frankie Vali & the Four Seasons.
Title: N/A

reviewText: While looking for some new concert dvds on Amazon,i came across the Frankie Valli concert,I did not know that there was one out, unless I missed it at the concert sections it the stores.Being a fan of this great music,from the 60s,i could not wait to get it,one day early on delievery,right to the big screen, and the sound system turnned up,it was by far one of the best concerts I have bought.I was a teenager at that time,and that music was the best.This concert was done to perfection,a great band,not missing a beat or note,and with a solid sound on every song.This concert was great,Frankie Valli And The Four Seasons delivered on every song,for a concert that was done 19 years ago,i have to say the quality of the audio and video were grate,not bad at all for not having todays new technology in electronics,they did a very good job.It was a great feeling to me,to here this type of music ,a trip back in time when music was fun and a much diferent way of life,5 stars to this one, a must buy in my book,if you were growing up in that era,and loved the music that was played, then this is your best bet for that kind of sound,thanks Amazon and to the sellers that have these kinds of dvds in stock to purchase.
summary: Frankie Valli and The Four Seasons Concert
Title: N/A

reviewText: I admit I'm not a Frankie Valli "fan". I like him, the 4 Seasons, and his music. I bought this DVD as I like to watch concerts when working out on my rowing machine. So I was expecting a live album with video.The songs are great, very few surprises there. But this is more a tribute to Mr. Valli's professionalism, not his enthusiasm. He's still a great performer (very little falsetto anymore, which is fine), and he knows how to work the crowd. But overall, he seems to be going through the motions. He's singing songs and using patter as if he's done this thousands of times before -- which he has. I don't know if he's having an off night, or this is just his style, but don't expect to be blown away by his stage presence or feel a special concert "spark". It's just not there.What is there is a good set list of tunes you'll remember and enjoy. I recommend this DVD, as long as you manage your expectations.

reviewText: If any one knows any thing about music and the previous pin head reviwer does NOT... Frankie while being much YOUNGER when he recorded his classics with the Four Seasons it still incredible to see live... While true the original FOUR SEASONs have broken up decades ago..Franki has but together a top notch band and the trip down memory lane is incredible. He lays down hit after hit after hit... Not many singers have the longevity that Mr Valli has. I was at this show  in Atlantic City and it was incredible and for the so called doubters and people that know absolutely about music My first concert this Franki and the 4 Seasons was at the Latin Casino in NJ and let me tell you something while he has grown older and cant quite hit those incredible high notes he and his band still ROCK and I challange any on at his age do to what he does in concert....If you are a fan of the Four Seasons and Franki Valli DO NOT MISS this. You should have this in your collection....Let the others take teir Ball and GO HOME!! Franki ROCKS!!!
summary: After all the years Franki Valli Still Rocks!!!

reviewText: I've always been a 4 Seasons fan.  I was disappointed, however, that the original members of the group backing Frankie Valli had moved on.  Bob Gaudio I know is a producer, and was behind the scenes on the making of this concert.  So I lost a little "something" there. And that youngman at the keyboards (I don't remember his name) seemed just a little out of place. In all, however, this was Frankie Valli's vintage songs and style,  and I am happy with the concert on DVD, inspite of the little things I mentioned above. Thank you.  Teri
